intro: Calycodon, commonly known as the star-of-Bethlehem, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. The plants typically have basal leaves and produce small, clustered flowers with showy, often pink or white petals. Calycodon species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid environments. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens.
